<strong style="display: block;">What happens to a firm’s equity beta (β<sub>E</sub>) when leverage increases, assuming no taxes?</strong>

<label><input type="radio" name="module7_mcq_q24" value="A"> A. It remains equal to the unlevered beta (β<sub>U</sub>).</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module7_mcq_q24" value="B"> B. It decreases because debt absorbs part of the risk.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module7_mcq_q24" value="C"> C. It increases proportionally with the debt-to-equity ratio.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module7_mcq_q24" value="D"> D. It becomes zero.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module7_mcq_q24" value="E"> E. It becomes negative.</label><br>
